intro: Hemitelia minima, commonly known as the small hemitelia, is a small herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface. Hemitelia minima produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes.
